title: Brazilan Cheese Bread
description: Brazilian Cheese Bread (PÃ£o de Queijo) is a dream come true for anyone who is gluten-free. I first had them earlier this year at a party and found out they were from Trader Joeâ€™sâ€¦which led me to search out the recipe, buy tapioca flour, and never make them because life got in the way. Tale as old as time! Last Friday night we were going through the freezer, seeing if we could make some franken-meal with whatever was leftover. Into the air fryer went a bunch of random things including three little rolls of Brazilian Cheese Bread. Three little rolls between the two of us werenâ€™t enough so I looked up the ingredients, found out I had them all and 10 minutes later, we had some in the oven. I live for that kind of thrill.Â  How do we describe the texture? They are light and fluffy like a popover but kinda chewy like if grilled cheese and mochi had a baby. These are definitely worth keeping a supply of tapioca flour in your pantry.Â  (I get mine at our local Asian grocery store) Casey proceeded to take these little breads a step further and gave them a garlic knot treatment. Brazilian cheese bread tossed in butter, garlic, and parsley? I dare you to not eat the whole batch They will make you believe in holiday magic again.Â  Ingredients involved! I blended the mixture in our NutribulletÂ  Prepare mini muffin tins with cooking spray.Â  Pour the batter in. Top with extra Parmesan.Â  Set them on a baking sheet and pop them in the oven.Â  TADA. Theyâ€™re light and puffy!Â  I am going to make a batch soon thatâ€™s HEAVY on the pepper.Â  Squish and chew!Â  Brazilian Cheese Bread Note: There is a print link embedded within this post, please visit this post to print it. Â  makes 24 1 egg 1/3 cup olive oil 2/3 cup milk 1 1/2 cups tapioca flour 1/2 cup packed grated cheese 3 tablespoon grated Parmesan, divided 1 teaspoon salt Preheat oven to 400F. Spray 2 mini muffin tins with cooking spray and set aside.Â  Blend egg, olive oil, milk, tapioca flour, 2 tablespoons Parmesan and salt in a blender until well combined. Pour batter into mini muffin tin. Top each muffin with a sprinkle of the rest of the Parmesan. Bake for 15 minutes, or until golden brown. Serve warm.Â  Â  The post Brazilan Cheese Bread appeared first on Shutterbean.
excerpt: Need a gluten-free option for a party? Make Brazilian Cheese Bread! 24 mini rolls made with cheese & tapioca flour! Recipe on Shutterbean.com

html:
Brazilian Cheese Bread (PÃ£o de Queijo) is a dream come true for anyone who is gluten-free. I first had them earlier this year at a party and found out they were from Trader Joeâ€™sâ€¦which led me to search out the recipe, buy tapioca flour, and never make them because life got in the way.Â  Tale as old as time!

Last Friday night we were going through the freezer, seeing if we could make some franken-meal with whatever was leftover. Into the air fryer went a bunch of random things including three little rolls of Brazilian Cheese Bread. Three little rolls between the two of us werenâ€™t enough so I looked up the ingredients, found out I had them all and 10 minutes later, we had some in the oven. I live for that kind of thrill.Â 

How do we describe the texture?Â  They are light and fluffy like a popover but kinda chewy like if grilled cheese and mochi had a baby. These are definitely worth keeping a supply of tapioca flour in your pantry.Â 

(I get mine at our local Asian grocery store)

Casey proceeded to take these little breads a step further and gave them a garlic knot treatment.Â  Â Brazilian cheese bread tossed in butter, garlic, and parsley? I dare you to not eat the whole batch ðŸ˜‰Â  They will make you believe in holiday magic again.Â 

Ingredients involved!

I blended the mixture in our NutribulletÂ 

Prepare mini muffin tins with cooking spray.Â 

Pour the batter in. Top with extra Parmesan.Â 

Set them on a baking sheet and pop them in the oven.Â 

TADA.

Theyâ€™re light and puffy!Â 

I am going to make a batch soon thatâ€™s HEAVY on the pepper.Â 

Squish and chew!Â 

Brazilian Cheese Bread

makes 24

  • 1 egg
  • 1/3 cup olive oil
  • 2/3 cup milk
  • 1 1/2 cups tapioca flour
  • 1/2 cup packed grated cheese
  • 3 tablespoon grated Parmesan, divided
  • 1 teaspoon salt

Preheat oven to 400F. Spray 2 mini muffin tins with cooking spray and set aside.Â 

Blend egg, olive oil, milk, tapioca flour, 2 tablespoons Parmesan and salt in a blender until well combined. Pour batter into mini muffin tin. Top each muffin with a sprinkle of the rest of the Parmesan. Bake for 15 minutes, or until golden brown. Serve warm.Â
